transportAdvice: Carmel-by-the-Sea is a small, highly walkable village where most galleries, shops, and restaurants are within easy walking distance. A car is recommended for exploring the scenic coastline, Point Lobos, and Big Sur. Limited public transit serves the broader Monterey Peninsula.

weather.description: Cool and rainy, with lush green hillsides and moody coastal scenery; pack rain gear.
Continued rain with occasional sunny breaks; wildflowers begin to appear toward month's end.
Transitional month with decreasing rain and warming temperatures; spring blooms along the coast.
Pleasant and mostly dry with mild temperatures, perfect for coastal walks and gallery visits.
Coastal fog becomes more common, with cool mornings often clearing to pleasant afternoons.
June gloom brings morning fog that typically burns off by midday; bring a light jacket for mornings.
Mild summer with persistent morning fog and pleasant afternoon temperatures.
Similar to July with fog and mild conditions; one of the warmest months overall.
Often the warmest month as fog decreases, with clear skies and beautiful coastal sunsets.
Warm and clear Indian summer weather, widely considered the best time to visit the area.
Cooling temperatures with the first autumn rains returning; quieter and more peaceful.
Cool and wet with festive holiday charm in the village; a cozy time to explore galleries and restaurants.
